Questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
Responses: I am not able to download the newest version of R on my workplace computer. I have contacted the IT department of the Capital Region, where I am working. They will not allow a newer version of R at this moment.

Questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
Responses: I can only update the Rstudio to 1.2.5001 (the latest available version in software shop), but once I close it and open it again it returns to the previously installed version and r3 commands give an error. I have re-installed it but the problem was not solved, I am contacting work helpdesk.

Responses: I could not make the first commands because I did not have Rtools.

Questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
Responses: I didn't get the same sort of response from my commands to install packages etc. so thought that they hadn't installed correctly.

Responses: I got many error comments while tried to instal the "remotes" package

Questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
Responses:
I had a lot of read text in the R programme when running the codes, but I believe that the packages were succesfully installed at last as it said:... package ‘prodigenr’ successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked, etc.

column3: and I had to take different decisions about the required installation files

Questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
Responses: Please have a look at my previously answer

Questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
Responses: we don't have administrator rights on the work computers in RegionH, so all programs need to be installed via the software/ computer center of the Region. they add requested programs to the " softwareshop" upon request, but that takes quite some time since they need to be checked for saftety. It is meant to help protect patient data but can make installing programs very slow.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: Code of conduct could be shorter. I understand it is necessary, but very wordy :)

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: Guidelines for installation of Git. I hade to go through a lot of steps. I just choose the defualt setting - and hope this is right. A note on whtether this is what should be done could be nice. And is something else should be done, this should be described.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: Hvis linket havde virket hele tiden

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I am satisfied

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I cannot think of anything, everything was very clear and well structured.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I didn't get the exact same output in R-studio as in the GIF videos - but it seemed to work anyway. It was fine to use short GIF's to show how to do - but its a bit tricky to spot what the first step was (since the GIF just continues to run). Maybe a video-player where you can stop/play as you want would be better. (however not a big problem when the video is so short)

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I had to install the package 'remotes' prior to starting, which was fine, but it's not mentioned on the page (unless I missed it!). Might cause some confusion for some people who have never opened R prior to this:)

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I have troubles installing Gitlab, It said: These packages have more recent versions available. It it took me three attemps to do it.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I think although having problems with Git, all the instructions are straight forward

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I think it was quite straight and easy to follow.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I think it's good as it is.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I thought the pre-course material was more time demanding. Maybe I have missed something.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: I was unsure whether earlier versions of R could be used (the newest was not available to me as an Region H employed). But got an email answer on that, so all good.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: In the beginning I had some problems to be able to solve the tasks, because I needed to download Rtools. This was not described in chapter 2, but after some time I managed to solve the problem using the instructions in R.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: it is a problem to install/update certain softwares in the work computer and the helpdesk does not help in such short time. In the end, everything turned out to work, but it took much longer than I predicted to complete the pre-tasks. Since this course is to apply to our work, it would be good to consider and desgn the course to be done in the work computer.

Questions: In your opinion, what could be improved?
Responses: It was in the beginning a bit unclear what exercises I should complete and what I should save, and what was done in the course itself (e.g., the group work assignment).

Responses: It would be good if the material contains a section of "possible errors/mistakes" during the preparation

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses:
Good text descriptions and nice that the codes are included so it can be copy-pasted into R-studio. 
Good idea to let everyone see what and how to install necessary programs before the course, so we don't spend time on this in the actual course.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: good to get familiar with Rstudio, with the gifs

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: I succeeded to install all programs, even though we have some problems with administrator rights in the RegionH. It is great to have the gifs with the screenshots. It is also very convenient to have the webpage with the entire program available beforehand. My colleage enquired about the administrative/ R version issues and that was immediately taken up on the webpage.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: I think it was very easy to follow the instructions when downloading the R packages

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: I think the tasks are clearly described and easy to follow

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: Interactive GIF images that describe required tasks

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: It was a nice guidance with combined gifs, texts, and practical assignments.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: It was a very easy-to-follow manual. And I had no trouble downloading GIT although working on a windows computer

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: It was very easy to understand what to do and follow the instructions in the pre-couse material. The small videos (eg. on to install packages) worked very well.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: Most of it - if you have right to install programs on your computer (I have but many of my collegues don't). I have R and Rstudio from our softwareshop at my working place, and the newest versions are not the newest available, but I will keep those i have from our softwareshop.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: No problems, but took some time to understand and implement

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: Overall chapter 2 is very pedagogical and it is easy to overlook the text.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: The course seems well thought out. It definitely helps to know the softwares (especially the versions) required for the course and ensuring that they are preinstalled before we start the course.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: The GIFs were a great way to ensure I was on the right track.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: The GIFs worked very well. Easy overview.

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: The web-page is very well written.  However, I could not download the latest version of R. I have asked the administrators to make the latest version available but it takes several weeks to do so... I also had problems with the initial task because my computer did not have Rtools but that was solved. I hope the course will be possible even though it is not the latest version...

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: very clear and straightforward

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

Questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
Responses: yes, it work well but have a little trouble with Git

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses:
1. I would like to be able to calculate time in range, time in hypo and time in hyper in the continuos glucose monitoring measurements that I have collected in my clinical study.
2. I want to learn a code on how to find a certain time in an excel column or row and calculate for exampel time in range for that certain time-period.  
3. I also want to learn simple statistics like mean etc...
4. I want enough knowledge to be able to correctly ask about codes/commands in a R-chat group. (Show where to go to get help and to continue learning modern data analysis skills.)
5. I absolutely want to learn *the fundamental tools and skills for conducting a reproducible and modern analysis for a research project.*

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Basic analytical skills performed in R, data visualization, and reproductive research.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Basic knowledge about and skills in R. To be able to do basic analyses af data in R on my own, and have a overview of the different functions in R.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Basic programming in R

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: data analysis, visualization of omics data. Be familiar with Github and the resources.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Do diffirent kind of analysis and save the log-file and results in various formats (datasets, excel, word, figures)

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Doing data preparation in R and getting a better understanding of how R works

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Fundamental tools and skills for conducting analyses for a research project with use of R.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: How can I use R in my data analysis? I am doing transcriptomics, but through our bioinformation, I like to be able to do or understand myself

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect R to less of a mystery. I have worked very little with R, but it involved following a script from a colleague. Although I completely trust my colleague, I would like to be able to trouble-shot myself when necessary and to discuss the script and the analysis we're doing while also being capable of using R independently in my future data analysis

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect to be able to run simple to more advanced analysis after the course and that the course will increase my skills and interest for statistical computing

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect to get a good introduction and basic skills in R, and to be inspired to conduct my future analysis and research in the programme.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect to get familiar with methods for data management and analyses in R, and I hope to be able to use these in my work when the course is over.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect to get more familiar with R and get information on how to use R in a way where  analyses will be more reproducible

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect to learn a little more about how to use R in a good way, in order to do reproducible data analysis

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect to learn basics in how to program in R to analyse data from my PhD project

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I expect to learn coding basics and also the work flows. I hope to process and analyze my own RNAseq data and and also available RNAseq and gene expression array datasets in public databases.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I have never used tidyverse, so I would like to learn it. I would like to use R more effectively and efficiently for my analysis.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I hope to be able to do EWAS (epigenome-wide association studies) on my own - without being totally dependent on bioinformations:-)

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I hope to get an understanding how R works and how I can use it in my project. I hope that I will understand the basics and know where I can learn more about it later.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses:
I hope to learn what is R, what can it do and how can it be used for data analysis and presentation (in my working area)
After the course I would like to be able to do some basic analyses with R and understand enough about it, so that I can learn more by myself.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I want to learn about I can track any changes to my analysis files, and How can I write reports to describe my data analyses in a reproducible way.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I would like to be familiar with R and to know how to find and use information I need to conduct data analyses in R

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I would like to learn the basics of data analysis and visualisation with R to work with my proteomics data independently of statistics software.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I would like to perform reproducible data analysis in R and produce publication-quality data visualizations.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: I would like to use R as a default for analysing the data sets I obtain from my work projects

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: In general, I am looking to improve my skills in using R to perform statistical analysis. More specifically, I am hoping to learn new skills for managing larger projects using repositories etc. when I am having to collaborate with lots of other researchers/data analysts.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Introduction to R. Be able to switch to R when analysing data where R packages are available, especially graphical output

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Jeg håber at blive klar til grundige analyser af epidemiologisk data indhentet via surveys evt. krydset med registerdata

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses:
Learn how to and be able to use R and learn the coding language
Learn how to and be able to handle data, datamanagement, and how to save and document the work, so it will be easy to access later on.
Learn where to search/look up for help for specific analyses in R.
Afterward i would like to be able to handle large datasets (registers) using R.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Perform basic statistics in R. Make nice figures. Learn the basics of "big data" handling in R - for example in relation to various omics datasets.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Project management and tidyverse, which will both help the data analyses of my PhD project

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: To learn how to manage data and use R projects and GitHub. Also to learn how to make my data analysis project reproducible and how to make publication-quality figures. Additionally to learn how to use collaborative tools and techniques when working in team settings.

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: To use R in a more efficient and reproducible manner. I am preparing an R pipeline for my data analysis that we want to publish and make accesible to the community as an R package

Questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
Responses: Understand R a bit better, and how to reproduce data analysis
